alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 3:53AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOODING POSSIBLE ON THE TANANA RIVER STARTING TODAY... Glacial rivers draining the Alaska Range such as the Tanana, Chisana, and Nabesna Rivers are near bankfull. This is due to high freezing levels causing significant high elevation snow melt in the Alaska Range. This along with periods of heavy showers over the Southeast Interior through Monday have dropped significant rain southeast of a line from Eagle to Kantishna, with up to 2 inches along the Alaska Range. This will cause water levels to rise sharply on all rivers across the Southeast Interior this week. The Tanana River will have an increased risk of flooding of low lying areas starting today and continuing through the week. People in the Rosie Creek Subdivision near Fairbanks should prepare for potential flooding this week, with water levels similar to what happened with the high water in 2011 and 2012. For the latest river information go to www.weather.gov/aprfc.

area.areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands
